posts.content:
Got an email earlier about this:

Dear Customer,

We are sorry to have to inform you that Plymouth Volksfest 2015 has been cancelled.

Please find following the official statement from the promoters of the event;

It is with regret that we have have had to cancel the 2015 show. Owing to the deteriorating health of a key partner in our very small team, the difficult decision was made yesterday.

We thank you for your support at this very difficult time

PVF Events

You will receive a refund for the full face value of your tickets, as per our Terms and Conditions. To apply for your refund, please email volksfest@theticketsellers.co.uk , stating your name and order number.

We will refund you using the method you used to pay; please allow 3-5 working days from receipt of your email for funds to clear back into your account.

Please accept our apologies for the inconvenience caused when an event is cancelled.

Many thanks for booking with TheTicketSellers.co.uk

Andy
Customer Support


http://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/Volksfe ... story.html
So there it is O.C.D. will be the only VW event in the south west this bank holiday for more than 20 years
